result.execSummary:
The defendant Darryl Clark Woodard Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, and 3: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges by end of probation or, civil judgment if not paid.
- Court set restitution at zero. Family Court to determined.
- No contact with firearms. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No Contact with victim unless approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- Pay supervision fees.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Darryl C Woodard
Current: PO Box 16207, Milwaukee, WI 53216-0207 United States  (Effective: 09-03-2015)
Prior: 4012 West Center Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210

Defendant Darryl C Woodard in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Darryl C Woodard in custody.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case is in court for a jury trial.
The defendant wants to change his plea.
 Plea hearing continued....
As to counts 2 and 3:
 Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
The parties wish to proceed to sentencing....
As to count 1:
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 76 days time served.  Time served disposition.
As to counts 2 and 3:
. Sentencing proceeded...
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8 months in the House of Correction as to each count, concurrent, with credit for -0- days served;  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 years concurrent, with the following conditions:
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges by end of probation; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.  Court will leave that up to the family court to determine.
Court will allow probation to be transferred to Ozaukee County.
. 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Court set bail of $250.00 in this matter. Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY, defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Comply with no contact order. No firearms or dangerous weapons.

Defendant Darryl C Woodard in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Darryl C Woodard in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Return of Doctor's Report. Court reviewed report, defendant found competent to proceed. Parties did not contest findings. Court reinstated proceedings. State's motion for joinder of 15CM1810, 15CM1638, 15CM1356 & 14CM3789 for trial. All matters set for Jury Trial on 8/3/2015 at 8:30 AM. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Jury trial scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Wisconsin Forensic Unit Report.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Darryl C Woodard not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
BRANCH 45 for BRANCH 23.
Case scheduled for bail/bond hearing.    Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Case spun to br. 45, Reserve Branch at 1:30 PM.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with April B

Defendant Darryl C Woodard in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Darryl C Woodard in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
